description: Enterprise techniques used by Matroyshka, ATT&CK software S0167 v1.1
name: Matroyshka (S0167)

techniques.comment: Matroyshka can establish persistence by adding Registry Run keys.[1][2]
Matroyshka is capable of providing Meterpreter shell access.[1]
Matroyshka is capable of stealing Outlook passwords.[1][2]
Matroyshka obfuscates API function names using a substitute cipher combined with Base64 encoding.[2]
Matroyshka uses reflective DLL injection to inject the malicious library and execute the RAT.[2]
Matroyshka can establish persistence by adding a Scheduled Task named "Microsoft Boost Kernel Optimization".[1][2]
Matroyshka is capable of performing screen captures.[1][2]
Matroyshka uses rundll32.exe in a Registry Run key value for execution as part of its persistence mechanism.[2]
